title: Setup Monitoring and Logging Infrastructure
description: Implement comprehensive monitoring and logging infrastructure for the Multi-Tenant Appointment Booking System. This includes setting up centralized logging, application performance monitoring, and alerting mechanisms.

effort_estimate.justification: Setting up a robust monitoring and logging system requires integrating multiple tools and establishing proper alerting mechanisms. This is crucial for system reliability and operational efficiency.

user_stories: As a system administrator, I want monitoring so that I can detect and respond to issues quickly
As a developer, I need logging so that I can troubleshoot problems effectively
business_rules: All system activities must be logged for audit and debugging purposes
Performance metrics must be collected and monitored continuously
Alerting must be configured for critical system events
Logs must be searchable and analyzable
edge_cases: Ensuring log security and privacy compliance
Managing alert fatigue with appropriate thresholds

acceptance_criteria: Centralized logging system is configured and collecting logs
Key metrics are being tracked and displayed in dashboards
Alerting rules are configured for critical events
Log retention and archival policies are implemented
Monitoring dashboards are accessible to authorized personnel

blocking_information.blocking_reason: Project structure and containerization must be established first to integrate monitoring components properly

additional_context.technical_notes: Follow the monitoring and logging architecture from the LLD document. Ensure integration with containerized services and implement proper log aggregation and analysis capabilities.
additional_context.design_references: Monitoring & Logging Service component in LLD documentation
additional_context.security_considerations: Ensure log data is protected and compliant with data privacy regulations
